abstract: George L Sherry, a former United Nations official who helped calm crises around the world, a role that evolved from his time as the leading rapid-fire translator of speeches by Russian diplomats in the organization’s early days, dies at age 87.
snippet: In the years just after the founding of the United Nations in 1945, Mr. Sherry became known as the English-speaking voice of Andrei Y. Vishinsky, the Soviet delegate.
lead_paragraph: In the years just after the founding of the United Nations in 1945, Mr. Sherry became known as the English-speaking voice of Andrei Y. Vishinsky, the Soviet delegate.

headline.main: George L. Sherry, Envoy and Well-Known Voice at U.N., Dies at 87
headline.print_headline: George L. Sherry, 87, Envoy and Well-Known Voice at U.N.
headline.seo: George L. Sherry, Voice at U.N., Dies at 87
